intro: Microtropis kinabaluensis var. acuminata, commonly known as the Kinabalu microtropis, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Mount Kinabalu in Borneo. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and slender, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky and shaded environments, showcasing adaptations to its alpine habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and elliptical, with a slight pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
